Constructor Detail

public Node()
This constructor creates a simple node.

Method Detail

addChild

public int addChild(Node child)
Add a node as child. This throws a RuntimeException if the given child already has a parent

Parameters:
child - the child to add
Returns:
The index of the child node

addChild

public int addChild(Node child,
                    int index)
Add a node as child at the given index. This throws a RuntimeException if the given child already has a parent.

Parameters:
child - the child to add
index - the index to put the child node
Returns:
the index of the added child node

getChild

public Node getChild(int index)
Get the child at the given index.

Parameters:
index - the index of the requested child
Returns:
the child at the specified index

getChildren

public Node[] getChildren()
Get an array containing all the (direct) children. This is equivalent to getChildren(true).

Returns:
an array containing all the children

getChildren

public Node[] getChildren(boolean includeHidden)
Get an array containing all the (direct) children. If includeHidden is false, only children that are not hidden (that is, only children where isShow evaluates to true) are returned.

Parameters:
includeHidden - specify whether to include hidden nodes or not
Returns:
an array containing the children

getParent

public Node getParent()
Get this node's parent.

Returns:
the parent node, or null if this is not a child node.

getParentIndex

public int getParentIndex()
Get the index of this node with its parent. If this node is not a child, this method returns -1.

Returns:
the index of this node with its parent, or -1 if there is no parent

getChildEdge

public Edge getChildEdge(int index)
Get an Edge between this node and a child. Equivalent to getChild(index).getEdge()

Parameters:
index - the index of the child
Returns:
the Edge between this node and its child at given index

getEdge

public Edge getEdge()
Get the Edge between this node and its parent. This throws a RuntimeException if this node has no parent.

Returns:
the Edge between this node and its parent

removeChild

public Node removeChild(int index)
Remove (separate) the child at the given index from its parent. Note that this will also remove the associated Edge object.

Parameters:
index - the index of the child to separate
Returns:
the separated child

removeFromParent

public void removeFromParent()
Remove this node from its parent. This throws a RuntimeException if there is no parent.

hide

public void hide()
Hide this node. This node will be hidden from the tree scene, even if its parents are all set to show.

show

public void show()
Show this node. This node will be visible in the tree scene if its parents are all set to show.

isChild

public boolean isChild()
Is this node a child?

Returns:
true if this node has a parent, false otherwise.

partOfTree

public boolean partOfTree()
Is this node part of a tree?

Returns:
true if this node is part of a Tree object, false otherwise

isVisible

public boolean isVisible()
Is this node visible? This checks whether all nodes between this and the root are set to show (including this node). If you want to check the 'show' state of this node, use isShow().

Returns:
true if the node is visible, false if it is hidden

isShow

public boolean isShow()
Is this node set to show? Note that this checks the Node's own 'show' setting. If you want to know whether a Node is visible from the root, use isVisible.

Returns:
true if the node is set to show, false if it is hidden

countAllChildren

public int countAllChildren(boolean includeHidden)
Count this node's children. This includes indirect children. When includeHidden is set to false, this method will not count nodes where isShow() evaluates to false, or any of their children.

Parameters:
includeHidden - true to include nodes that are not visible
Returns:
the amount of child nodes

countChildren

public int countChildren(boolean includeHidden)
Count the amount of child nodes. If includeHidden is false, only child nodes where isShow() evaluates to true are counted.

Parameters:
includeHidden - count hidden nodes or not
Returns:
the amount of child nodes

setComponent

public void setComponent()
Set the current component and, if needed, add it to the tree scene. This variant makes a default component (using TreeScene.makeDefaultComponent()). Throws RuntimeException if there is no TreeScene to use.

setComponent

public void setComponent(org.mt4j.components.visibleComponents.shapes.MTRectangle in)
Set the current component and, if needed, add it to the tree scene. This variant takes a MTRectangle to use as component. Throws RuntimeException if there is no TreeScene to use. Note that the component can be set to null, in order to remove the component without adding a new one. In that case, a default component will be generated on the next Tree update. If this node, or its Tree, is to be detached from its TreeScene (or MTApplication), the current component should be removed by setComponent(null) and reattached/copied after the move.

Parameters:
in - the component to associate with this node

getComponent

public org.mt4j.components.visibleComponents.shapes.MTRectangle getComponent()
Get the component reference. Can give null if no component is set.

Returns:
the MT4j component, or null if there is none

getObject

public java.lang.Object getObject()
Get this node's additional object.

Returns:
the additional object

setObject

public void setObject(java.lang.Object in)
Set this node's additional object. Each node can contain a single Object that may be used for identification or storage of other application-specific data. Note that for a more flexible way to add additional data to a node, you can make subclasses of Node.

Parameters:
in - the additional object to set

getTree

public Tree getTree()
Get the Tree instance this node is a part of.

Returns:
an instance of Tree, or null if partOfTree() is false
